thread.title: Fed#039;s Williams Foresees Rate Hike Despite Recent #039;Close Call#039;
thread.title_full: Fed#039;s Williams Foresees Rate Hike Despite Recent #039;Close Call#039;

title: Fed#039;s Williams Foresees Rate Hike Despite Recent #039;Close Call#039;
text:
Get Business & Technology Alerts 
20 Sep 2015 01:25 PM EST 
A top Fed policymaker said on Saturday that a U.S. interest rate hike will likely be appropriate this year, given the Federal Reserve's decision last week to stand pat was a "close call." John Williams is a centrist and the president of the San Francisco Fed. He said the arguments for and against beginning to tighten U.S. monetary policy are roughly balanced, now that the economy is on solid footing. That gives him confidence in continued economic and labor market growth. In a speech that suggested he is almost ready to pull the trigger on a rate hike, Williams also acknowledged the risks from a slowdown in China and global downward pressure on inflation.
